overview.description: Complete guide for writing App Store metadata (name, subtitle, description, keywords)
overview.goal: Create compelling, accurate, policy-compliant metadata that drives downloads
overview.seo_importance: Metadata directly impacts App Store search ranking and conversion

app_name.priority: CRITICAL - primary factor in search discovery
optimization_tips: Include primary keyword if natural (e.g., 'Budget Tracker')
Test multiple names with A/B testing (Product Page Optimization)
app_name.ai_generation_prompt: Generate 10 app name options for [APP_DESCRIPTION], max 30 characters, include primary keyword [KEYWORD], memorable and easy to spell

subtitle.priority: HIGH - appears below name in search results
guidelines: Summarize app value in concise phrase
subtitle.ai_generation_prompt: Generate 5 subtitle options for [APP_NAME], max 30 characters, highlight main benefit or feature, no generic terms

description.priority: HIGH - influences conversion after user views screenshots

paragraph_1_opening.purpose: Hook user with compelling value proposition
paragraph_1_opening.critical: First sentence visible without 'Read More' - make it count
paragraph_1_opening.example: [APP_NAME] helps you [PRIMARY_BENEFIT] with [KEY_FEATURE]. Join [X] users who [RESULT].

section_3_details.purpose: Elaborate on features, use cases, unique value

section_4_social_proof.example: Featured by Apple as App of the Day. Rated 4.8 stars by 50,000+ users.

guidelines: Focus on user benefits (not just features)
Use active voice and strong verbs
NO references to other apps or platforms

description.ai_generation_prompt: Write an App Store description for [APP_NAME], a [CATEGORY] app that [PRIMARY_FUNCTION]. Target audience: [DEMOGRAPHICS]. Tone: [PROFESSIONAL/CASUAL/PLAYFUL]. Include 5 key features, benefits-focused, max 4000 characters.

guidelines: Research relevant search terms users actually use
Balance popular terms (high competition) vs niche terms (easier ranking)
NO plural if singular already included (saves characters)
NO special characters (#, @) unless part of brand
keyword_research_methods: App Store search suggestions (type keyword, see autocomplete)
Competitor keyword analysis (search for competitors, see what keywords they rank for)
User reviews (see how users describe your app type)
Keyword research tools (App Annie, Sensor Tower, AppTweak)
optimization_strategy: Use app name + subtitle for high-competition keywords (budget, finance)
Use keyword field for mid-tail keywords (expense tracker, bill manager)
Test keyword variations with App Store Optimization tools
Monitor ranking for each keyword, iterate monthly
keywords.ai_generation_prompt: Generate 15-20 relevant keywords for [APP_NAME], a [CATEGORY] app. Target use case: [USE_CASE]. Maximum 100 characters total, comma-separated, no spaces except within phrases. Include functional, benefit, and niche keywords.

promotional_text.priority: MEDIUM - optional, updatable without app submission
guidelines: Highlight latest news (new features, sales, events)
Can be updated anytime without submitting new version
NO keyword stuffing (not indexed for search)

whats_new.ai_generation_prompt: Write What's New text for [APP_NAME] version [VERSION]. Changes: [LIST_OF_CHANGES]. Format: bullet points, emoji optional, highlight most important changes first, max 4000 characters.

guidelines: Should contain help documentation, FAQs, or contact form

primary_category.importance: Determines which tab app appears in (Games or Apps)
selection_tips: Be specific (Finance > Personal Finance rather than just Business)

secondary_category.example: Expense tracker might use Finance (primary) + Productivity (secondary)

age_rating.critical_rule: Answer honestly - wrong rating causes rejection
guidelines: If app has user-generated content, select appropriate frequency
If app includes web views, select 'Unrestricted Web Access' if applicable
Metadata (screenshots, icons) must match age rating (4+ safe if rated 4+)

benefits: Increases downloads in localized markets by 50-100%
Improves search ranking in local App Stores
workflow: 1. Write metadata in primary language (e.g., English)
3. Translate via professional service or AI (with human review)
4. Import translations in App Store Connect
translation_tools: AI translation (DeepL, Google Translate with human review)
App Store Connect Metadata Translation (Apple's service)

keyword_stuffing.example: Budget app budget tracker budget money budget expenses budget tool
keyword_stuffing.symptom: Rejection for spam, poor user experience
keyword_stuffing.fix: Write naturally, keywords appear 1-2 times organically

misleading_claims.problem: Description promises features app doesn't have
misleading_claims.example: 'Free forever' but requires subscription after trial

generic_description.example: 'This is the best app ever. Download now!'
generic_description.symptom: Low conversion rate, poor search ranking
generic_description.fix: Be specific about features and benefits

wrong_category.problem: App in irrelevant category to avoid competition
wrong_category.symptom: Apple may change category, or rejection

testing_checklist.method: Verify app name â‰¤30, subtitle â‰¤30, keywords â‰¤100, description â‰¤4000
Check for trademarked terms, competitor names, false claims
Read description aloud, ensure natural flow, no keyword stuffing
Verify all claims in description match actual app functionality
Search for each keyword on App Store, verify it's a real search term
Browse category, ensure app fits with similar apps

step_1_analyze_app.ai_task: Read app description, features, target audience
step_1_analyze_app.output: App analysis (primary benefit, key features, USP, target users)

step_5_human_review.changes: Tweak tone, add brand voice, finalize selection
